TopicTitle: Enhanced Edition [PS4] - UI scaling of map information

Articles.Content:
I hope that devs will get to see this, or maybe someone reading will have the understanding of game versions to put my mind at ease a little.

Playing the enhanced edition on my TV I can't see the information that is available when hovering over trajectory/orbit lines in the map view. I just can't see it; it's too small unless I stand and walk nearer to the TV. The current PC version has an extra control for UI scaling that would solve the issue: there is an global UI scale control that works together with the UI flight element sliders, and this overall UI control does indeed increase the size of the data in the map view.

I'll have to leave the game on console for now, as I don't like to stand up all of the time. That kind of negates the reason I bought the console version. I will play the current PC version instead.

So my request is (or maybe question) when the console version moves forward will it include the global UI scale modifier that is part of the current PC version? If it will or not, would it be possible to beef things up so I could scale the map data be be even larger than the PC version would currently give when playing on a TV the other side of the room? Please bear in mind, developers, that peeps sitting on sofas 4 meters from their TVs need to see orbital information too.

I hope readers of this will understand that this isn't an angry rant; it's just that currently I really can't play the game on the sofa looking at my TV because I can't see the most essential information. 

Thanks for reading.

Edited January 19, 2018 by Fronto
